page.title: 11DEVONPORT
page.content: Fore street was the main street of Devonport before the{war(1939-45). } There were many public houses, three cinemas and a{theatre}called the 'Alhambra'. The streets were often filled with{sailors}off-duty. During the war Devonport was heavily{bombed} because the Germans wanted to destroy the{Royal Naval Dockyard.}Many houses were destroyed and after the war the Ministry of Defence decided to enlarge the Dockyard, so many houses were never rebuilt. Many old people remember Devonport before the war when it was a busy, friendly town with lots going on. Since the war Plymouth has been developed as the{shopping centre} for the whole area. Though they enjoy modern comforts many{senior citizens} miss the old days and feel that modern Devonport is a very different place to the town they once knew.
